isis.stitle: Procedural Guideline - HIGH PRESSURE OIL PUMP AND/OR DRIVE GEAR (V-8), REPLACE

wtsproc.wtsdescrip: HIGH PRESSURE OIL PUMP AND/OR DRIVE GEAR (V-8), REPLACE

step1.para: Chock wheels. Open door and hood.
Disconnect battery negative cables.
Remove charge air pipes and air intake y-pipe.
Remove power steering pump, lay aside and secure, but do not open system.
Disconnect electrical connections at high pressure oil pump and oil reservoir; include relay at valve cover.
Remove serpentine belt.
Siphon oil from reservoir.
Disconnect oil lines at high pressure oil pump and reservoir.
Remove EBP switch from reservoir, and remove reservoir and gasket.
Remove inspection cover for high pressure oil pump gear.
Remove high pressure oil pump drive gear.
Remove I.P.R. switch from high pressure oil pump.
Remove high pressure oil pump from engine.
Clean mating surfaces.
Install high pressure oil pump and new gasket. Torque bolts to specification.
Install I.P.R. switch to oil pump, and torque nut to specification.
Install high pressure oil pump drive gear and torque bolt to specification.
Apply sealant to inspection cover, install inspection cover, and torque bolts to specification.
Install new gasket to reservoir, base install reservoir and EBP switch, and torque bolts to specifications.
Install oil lines to high pressure oil pump.
Install power steering pump, and torque bolts to specification.
Connect electrical connections to pump reservoir pump and relay switch.
Install air intake y-pipe and charge air pipes.
Install serpentine belt.
Fill high pressure oil pump reservoir with clean oil.
Connect battery cables.
Start engine and check for leaks.
Close hood and remove wheel chocks.
